reviewText: The photography is pretty good here, but it's wasted by being badly jump-cut together and with a next-to-nothing story.  I'd give it a miss...
Don't even try to follow the plot. Just submerge into the beautiful photography of this picture. It's quite enough. I would compare this to some early Werner Herzog movies.

This 1971 Hungarian film is visually one of the most beautiful I have ever seen.  I will be glad to see it again, though the story of an aging roue revisiting all his old "loves" never engaged me on the intellectual or emotional level.
